Class InputController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.tetris.controller.ui.InputController
public class InputController extends Object
InputController is a dedicated wrapper that centralizes all input handling logic, including keyboard input, mouse hover, and click events. This separates input concerns from the GuiController, making the code more maintainable and testable.

  • Constructor Details

    • InputController

      public InputController(InputHandler inputHandler)
      Creates a new InputController with the specified InputHandler.
      Parameters:
      inputHandler - the InputHandler to delegate key input to

  • Method Details

    • setupKeyboardInput

      public void setupKeyboardInput(javafx.scene.Node focusNode)
      Attaches key event listeners to the provided focusNode. This method should be called once the scene is available.
      Parameters:
      focusNode - the node to attach keyboard listeners to

    • handleKeyPressed

      private void handleKeyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Handles keyboard input events by delegating to InputHandler. Special handling for rotation sound (KeyCode.R).
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - the keyboard event to handle

    • setupHoverSounds

      public void setupHoverSounds(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Sets up hover sound effects for buttons in the scene. This method attaches mouse move event filters to play sounds when hovering over buttons.
      Parameters:
      scene - the scene to attach hover listeners to

    • attachHoverHandler

      private void attachHoverHandler(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Attaches a scene-wide hover handler that detects button hovers.
      Parameters:
      scene - the scene to attach the handler to

    • setupClickSounds

      public void setupClickSounds(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Sets up click sound effects for buttons in the scene. This method attaches mouse pressed event filters to play sounds when clicking buttons.
      Parameters:
      scene - the scene to attach click listeners to

    • attachClickHandler

      private void attachClickHandler(javafx.scene.Scene scene)
      Attaches a scene-wide click handler that detects button clicks.
      Parameters:
      scene - the scene to attach the handler to

    • findButtonInHierarchy

      private javafx.scene.control.Button findButtonInHierarchy(javafx.scene.Node node)
      Traverses the node hierarchy to find a Button ancestor.
      Parameters:
      node - the starting node
      Returns:
      the Button if found, null otherwise

    • playButtonClickSound

      private void playButtonClickSound()
      Plays the button click sound effect.

    • playHoverSound

      private void playHoverSound()
      Plays the button hover sound effect.

    • requestFocus

      public void requestFocus(javafx.scene.Node focusNode)
      Requests focus on a specific node. Useful for ensuring keyboard input is captured.
      Parameters:
      focusNode - the node to focus

    • getInputHandler

      public InputHandler getInputHandler()
      Gets the underlying InputHandler.
      Returns:
      the InputHandler instance
